p.s: The given text is an excerpt from the sixth chapter of part two from the novel: The Tortilla Curtain , written by T. C. Boyle in 1995.
It deals with division of American society in the aspect of Mexican immigration.
The excerpt plays in the middle of the book.
After a quick talk with Todd Sweet about a phantom car Delaney had seen before, he recognizes a man on the lawn of his neighbours, the Cherrystones.
Seeing that he is a Mexican, he confronts him and realizes that he had known him because he had allegedly camped in the woods, illegally.
Kyra, his wivewife had also reported that she had seen him on one of her properties she owns as ana property agent, threatening her.
Delaney confronts him, asumingassuming that he is tresspassingtrespassing by asking if he could help him.
After a quick dispute with the Mexican who is confused, he tells Delaney that he works there.
Delaney feels very ashamed that he had convicted him a thief out of his anger.
Situations like this are playing an important role in the racist character development of Delaney in the book, even if in this situation he was the predator.
This comes to realization when he gets his life saved in the end by a Mexican.
